alert.note: Alert for Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued December 07 at 2:41PM MST until December 08 at 10:00PM MST by NWS Pocatello
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 PM MST THIS EVENING ABOVE 6500 FEET... ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM MIDNIGHT TONIGHT TO 10 PM MST FRIDAY... * WHAT...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, snow, moderate at times primarily above 6500 feet. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 3 inches in the mountains with up to 1 inch in the lower mountain-valleys. Winds gusting to 40 MPH at times. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, snow, moderate at times. Total snow accumulations of 6 to 10 inches across the mountains and 1 to 4 inches in the lower mountain-valleys. * WHERE...The Bear River Range, Caribou Range, Big Hole Mountains, Centennial Mountains, and Island Park, including but not limited to Emigration Summit, Wayan, Swan Valley, Pine Creek Pass, Victor, Island Park, Raynolds Pass, and Targhee Pass. * WHEN...For the first Winter Weather Advisory, until 6 PM this evening. For the second Winter Weather Advisory, from midnight tonight to 10 PM Friday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be difficult at times. Patchy blowing snow could significantly reduce visibility and create hazardous driving conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. Visit 511.idaho.gov for the latest road conditions.

area.areaDesc: Bear River Range; Big Hole Mountains; Caribou Range; Centennial Mountains, Island Park
